smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the provided file contain visual elements and content; no empty diagrams were found.
All use cases (oval elements) in the 'Treeningu funktsionaalne allsüsteem' diagram (Page 2) are connected to at least one actor.
No duplicate use case names associated with the same actor were found in the use case diagram.
No packages were found containing multiple model elements with the exact same name.
No redundant data columns were found between tables that were not already linked by Foreign Key relationships (e.g., 'riik_kood' is a FK).
Use case naming is consistent. All use cases (e.g., 'Vaata...', 'Registreeri...', 'Lõpeta...') start with a verb in the imperative form in Estonian.
In the state diagram (Page 11), all states ('Ootel', 'Aktiivne', etc.) are reachable from the Start node ('Alg') via transitions.
All actions in the activity diagrams (Pages 3 and 4) are reachable within the flow.
All class and database relationships on the diagrams display multiplicity indicators (e.g., 1, 0..*) at both ends.
The use case diagram 'Treeningu funktsionaalne allsüsteem' (Page 2) contains 11 central elements (use cases), which exceeds the limit of 10.

On the 'Treeningute register' diagram (Page 10), the class 'Treening' has exactly 6 visual connection lines to other elements (Isik, Töötaja (x2), Treeningu_seisundi_liik, Treening_kategooria_omamine, Treeningu asukoht).
The layout of the diagrams is reasonably compact, and no related elements are placed excessively far apart.
All use cases and activity diagram actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found with 3 or fewer characters. (Note: 'Id' stereotypes or suffixes are not element names).
All class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Treening').
Several attributes start with an uppercase letter instead of lowercase. Examples include 'Maksumus' in the 'Treening' class (Page 10) and 'Kirjeldus' in the 'Töötaja_roll' class (Page 7).
All table names in the transformed diagrams (e.g., 'Isik', 'Klient') are singular.
No Hungarian notation or type prefixes (like 'tbl_', 'str') were found on element names. (Key prefixes like 'PK_', 'FK_' are allowed).
